tool.name: PhyloPhlAn
tool.description: microbial genome characterization and phylogenetic analysis
tool.command:
#import re
#if "nt" in $config.analysis.value #set $db_type = "n" #else if "aa" in $config.analysis.value #set $db_type = "a" #else #set $db_type = $config.db.type #end if
#if $database.source == "cache" #set $db_name = re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', str($database.db_name)) #set $db_file = $database.db_name.fields.path #set $db_is_compressed = $db_file.endswith(".gz") #else #set $db_name = "database" #set $db_file = $database.db_file #set $db_is_compressed = $db_file.file_ext == "fasta.gz" #end if
mkdir -p 'input/' && #for $i in $input #set $identifier = re.sub('[^\w\-\._]', '_', str($i.element_identifier)) ln -s '$i' 'input/${identifier}' && #end for
mkdir -p 'database/${db_name}/' && #if not $db_is_compressed ln -s '$db_file' 'database/${db_name}/${db_name}.f${db_type}a' && #else gzip -d -c '$db_file' > 'database/${db_name}/${db_name}.f${db_type}a' && #end if
phylophlan_write_config_file -o config.cfg -d $db_type #if $trimming.trim != "None" --trim trimal #end if
#if $config.analysis == "supermatrix_nt" --db_dna makeblastdb --map_dna blastn --msa mafft --tree1 fasttree --tree2 raxml #else if $config.analysis == "supertree_nt" --db_dna makeblastdb --map_dna blastn --msa mafft --gene_tree1 fasttree --gene_tree2 raxml --tree1 astral #else if $config.analysis == "supermatrix_aa" --db_aa diamond --map_dna diamond --map_aa diamond --msa mafft --tree1 fasttree --tree2 raxml #else if $config.analysis == "supertree_aa" --db_aa diamond --map_dna diamond --map_aa diamond --msa mafft --gene_tree1 fasttree --gene_tree2 raxml --tree1 astral #else #if $config.db.type == "n" --db_dna $config.db.db_dna --map_dna $config.db.map_dna #else if $config.db.type == "a" --db_aa $config.db.db_aa --map_aa $config.db.map_aa #if $config.db.map_dna --map_dna $config.db.map_dna #end if #end if --msa $config.msa
#if $config.analysis == "custom_supertree" --gene_tree1 $config.gene_tree.gene_tree1 #if $config.gene_tree.gene_tree2 --gene_tree2 $config.gene_tree.gene_tree2 #end if --tree1 $config.tree.tree1 #else --tree1 $config.tree.tree1 #if $config.tree.tree2 --tree2 $config.tree.tree2 #end if #end if #end if
$force_nucleotides --overwrite &&
## fixing astral binary path sed -i "\%program_name.*astral%s%=.*%= `which astral`%" config.cfg &&
#if "supertree" in $config.analysis.value #if $config.maas.source == "history" #set $maas_file = $config.maas.models #else #set $maas_file = $__tool_directory__ + '/test-data/phylophlan.tsv' #end if python '$__tool_directory__/validate_mapping_file.py' '$maas_file' && #end if
phylophlan -i input -o output -d $db_name --databases_folder database -f config.cfg
--diversity $diversity $accuracy #if "supertree" in $config.analysis.value --maas '$maas_file' #end if
--min_num_proteins $quality.min_num_proteins --min_len_protein $quality.min_len_protein #if $quality.min_num_markers --min_num_markers $quality.min_num_markers #end if #if $quality.min_num_entries --min_num_entries $quality.min_num_entries #end if
$quality.remove_only_gaps_entries #if not $quality.remove_only_gaps_entries $quality.remove_fragmentary_entries #if $quality.fragmentary_threshold --fragmentary_threshold $quality.fragmentary_threshold #end if #end if
#if $trimming.trim != "None" --trim $trimming.trim #if $trimming.trim.value in {'gap_perc', 'greedy'} --gap_perc_threshold $trimming.gap_perc_threshold #end if #if $trimming.trim.value in {'not_variant', 'greedy'} --not_variant_threshold $trimming.not_variant_threshold #end if #end if
#if $sample.subsample != "default" and not ($sample.subsample == "phylophlan" and $db_name != "phylophlan") --subsample $sample.subsample #end if #if $sample.scoring_function --scoring_function $sample.scoring_function #end if #if $sample.submat --submat $sample.submat #end if
--unknown_fraction $quality.unknown_fraction $quality.convert_N2gap $force_nucleotides $sort $mrate.mutation_rates -t $db_type --nproc \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} --verbose

param.name: input
param.label: Input genomes and/or proteomes
param.help: In order for PhyloPhlAn to detect the input files in the collection, the fasta files MUST have the extensions '.fna' for nucleotide sequences and '.faa' for amino acid sequences. (Or '.fna.gz' and '.faa.gz' respectively.)

param.name: analysis
param.label: Configure which external software to use for the analysis
param.option: Nucleotide supertree (blast, mafft, fasttree, raxml, astral)
Amino acid supermatrix (diamond, mafft, fasttree, raxml)
Amino acid supertree (diamond, mafft, fasttree, raxml, astral)

param.label: Diversity
param.help: Set parameters to default values in accordance with the expected diversity of the phylogeny to be build.
param.option: high (for tree-of-life and higher-ranked taxonomic phylogenies)

param.name: accuracy
param.label: Reduce the number of considered phylogenetic positions (faster, but less accurate)
param.help: Affected parameters depend on the --diversity level.

section.name: quality
section.title: Input quality thresholds
section.help: Discard input genomes/proteomes and phylogenetic markers with insufficient quality.

param.label: Minimum mapped markers
param.help: Discard input genomes or proteomes that map to less markers.

param.label: Minimum found entries.
param.help: Discard markers that are detected in fewer genomes or proteomes than this threshold.

param.label: Fragmentary threshold
param.help: The fraction of gaps in the MSA to be considered fragmentary.

param.label: Remove gap-only entries
param.help:
Remove alignment entries that contain only gaps ("-")
Equivalent to enabling 'Remove fragmentary entries' with a threshold of 1.

param.label: Maximum unknown fraction
param.help: The fraction of unknowns ('X' and '-') allowed in each column of the MSA of the markers.

param.label: Convert Ns in nucleotides MSAs to gaps ('-') after MSAs
Gap threshold
param.help: Remove columns with a percentage of gaps above the threshold.

param.label: Variant threshold
param.help: Remove columns where at least one amino acid appears more often than the threshold frequency.

param.label: Gap threshold
param.help: Remove columns with a percentage of gaps above the threshold.

param.label: Variant threshold
param.help: Remove columns lacking variation, when any amino acid exceeds the threshold.

section.name: sample
section.title: Subsampling
section.help: Controls how many informative positions to retain per marker in the alignment.

param.label: How many positions per marker should be retained?
param.option: PhyloPhlAn (A retainment formula specific to the PhyloPhlAn marker database)

param.label: Scoring function
param.help: Ranks alignment positions for subsampling; affects which columns are kept in the trimmed alignment.

param.label: Substitution matrix
param.help: Used by the scoring function to prioritize conserved positions.

param.label: Force nucleotides
param.help: Force PhyloPhlAn to use nucleotide sequences for phylogenetic analysis, even when the database contains amino acids. PhyloPhlAn will ignore proteomes in the input collection.

param.label: Sort markers
param.help: Force PhyloPhlAn to sort markers in a defined order during concatenation. Only used with the supermatrix apprach.

param.label: Calculate mutation rates
param.help: If enabled, generates mutation rate tables for each aligned marker and a summary table for the concatenated MSA. This process can take a long time.

param.name: discard_individual_tables
param.label: Discard individual mutation rate tables.
param.help: Only the summary table will be added to the Galaxy history, but individual mutation rate tables are still calculated. If unchecked, they will be saved as a dataset collection.

tool.help:
PhyloPhlAn is an integrated pipeline for large-scale phylogenetic profiling of genomes and metagenomes. It is an accurate, rapid, and easy-to-use method for large-scale microbial genome characterization and phylogenetic analysis at multiple levels of resolution.
When using PhyloPhlAn 3, the user can customize each step of the pipeline to build the tree (marker genes identification, multiple sequence alignment, concatenation or gene trees inference, and phylogeny reconstruction).
Required Inputs ===============
- **Input genomes and/or proteomes**: A collection of (compressed) FASTA files. Genome and proteome inputs can be mixed. Files with `.fna` extensions are treated as genomes, and `.faa` as proteomes. - **Reference database of markers**: A multi-fasta file containing the marker sequences. - **Substitution models** (for the supertree pipeline): A mapping of amino acid markers to their respective RAxML substitution models.
When both markers and inputs are nucleotides, the phylogenetic analysis will be done on nucleotides. Otherwise, it will proceed in translated sequence space (amino acids). If the inputs are all genomes, the user can decide to specify the --force_nucletides parameter to perform the phylogenetic analysis on nucleotides.
Main Parameters ===============
- **Software Configuration**: Tune the pipeline according to the input and the type of markers in the database:
- Choose one of four predefined configurations for different database types and analysis pipelines. - OR assemble a custom pipeline from available external software (make sure to select the appropriate database type). - **Diversity** (--diversity) and **Accuracy** (--accurate or --fast): Set default values for several parameters at once (trimming, subsampling, fragmentary removal, etc.) in accordance with the expected diversity of the phylogeny to be built. [See https://github.com/biobakery/phylophlan/wiki#accurate-or-fast-1] - **Input quality thresholds**: Specify minimum requirements to include inputs and markers in the analysis and how to deal with gaps in the MSA. - **Trimming strategy** (--trim): Strategy used to remove uninformative regions from MSAs. - **Subsampling** (--subsample): Controls how many phylogenetically relevant positions to retain per marker in the alignment. See https://github.com/biobakery/phylophlan/wiki#scoring-function for more information on the scoring functions and substitution matrices. - **Force nucleotides** (--force_nucleotides): Perform the phylogenetic analysis on nucleotides (Ignore proteomes in the input collection). - **Sort markers** (--sort): sort the markers and consider them in a specific order (used only for the supermatrix pipeline). - **Mutation rates**: Calculate a mutation rates table for the concatenated MSA.
Generated Outputs =================
The specific outputs depend on the type of analysis and the specific software configuration.
**Supermatrix (FastTree / RAxML)** - concatenated.aln: Final alignment. - input.tre: Initial Approximately-Maximum-Likelihood Trees of the phylogeny. - resolved.tre: Phylogeny with polytomies resolved. - RAxML_log, RAxML_info: Information on the refinement and optimization history. - RAxML_result, RAxML_bestTree: Final phylogenetic tree (refined).
**Supermatrix (iqtree)** - concatenated.aln: Final alignment. - input.tre.bionj, input.tre.treefile: Reconstructed phylogeny. - input.tre.mldist: Pairwise maximum likelihood distances as a matrix. - input.tre.iqtree: Information on the analysis.
**Supertree** - gene_trees.tre: Gene trees before constructing the phylogeny. - input.tre: Final unrooted species tree.
**Mutation rates** - mutation_rates: Summary mutation rates table.
Notes =====
This version of the tool is missing some of the functionality of the original PhyloPhlAn pipeline, such as
- the external tools Opal and UPP as well as support for tool configurations files with custom parameters. - using aligned markers from StrainPhlAn.
Please don't hesitate to contact the tool maintainer should you need these options.
To add additional reference databases contact your Galaxy administrator.
Additional Resources ====================
PhyloPhlAn GitHub: https://github.com/biobakery/phylophlan
For further analysis you might consider the other tools of the PhyloPhlAn tool suite:
- phylophlan_assign_sgbs: Reports the closest species-level genome bins. - phylophlan_strain_finder: Perform analysis on trees built with phylophlan.
